sense.name: Foreshadow or presage.
sense.commentary: Note: action of the verb occurs before a new state or event.
sense.examples: The asteroid heralded a new era of life. Darkened skies herald rain. Snowmelt heralds Spring.

sense.name: Praise vociferously, perhaps at the outset of something.
sense.commentary: Note: action of the verb occurs while a new state or event is coming to be or already evident.
sense.examples: The critics heralded the pianist as a new master. They all heralded the knight's entrance. Flowers herald Spring. Her screams heralded the arrival of their newborn child.
